data.title: Ishwar Chandra Vidyasagar: Early Life
data.meta_description: Ishwar Chandra - Free download as Word Doc (.doc / .docx), PDF File (.pdf), Text File (.txt) or read online for free. Ishwar Chandra Vidyasagar was a 19th century Indian social reformer and educator from Bengal. Despite facing poverty in his early life, he received an excellent education and went on to become a Sanskrit scholar. He worked to reform education and society, advocating for women's rights and widow remarriage. Some of his major accomplishments include simplifying the Bengali alphabet, establishing schools for girls, and helping pass the Widow Remarriage Act of 1856. Vidyasagar was a prolific writer and lifelong champion of social justice who greatly impacted Indian society through his reforms.
